PREOP DX: Id[REDACTED] subglottic/tracheal stenosis
POSTOP DX: Same

PROCEDURE PERFORMED: Flexible bronchoscopy with endobronchial balloon dilation of tracheal stenosis (CPT 31630)

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation via 6.5 ETT

BRIEF DESCRIPTION:
Flexible bronchoscope was passed through the ETT. A short segment circumferential stenosis was id[REDACTED] approximately 2.5 cm below the vocal cords with roughly 60% luminal narrowing.

A CRE balloon catheter ([REDACTED] mm) was positioned across the stenosis under direct visualization. Serial inflations were performed:
- 8 mm x 60 seconds
- 10 mm x 60 seconds
- 12 mm x 90 seconds

After the final inflation, tracheal lumen improved to approximately 80% patency with minimal mucosal splitting. No stent placement, no ablative therapy and no biopsies were performed.

COMPLICATIONS: None. Estimated blood loss <5 mL.
DISPOSITION: Extubated in the OR, transferred to PACU in stable condition and discharged home later the same day with ENT and IP follow up.
